CONJUGATES: separating | separated | separates | separately (adv) | separator (n) | separation (n)
ETYMOLOGY: From Latin *sēparātus*, perfect passive participle of *sēparō* ('to separate, divide'), formed from *sē-* ('apart') + *parō* ('to prepare, put in order').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To divide into constituent parts; to pull or move objects, places, or people apart.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Security guards separated the two groups of protesters before a fight broke out.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在争斗爆发前，保安将两组抗议者隔开了。

MEANINGS.PATTERN:
a separate [sth]
[sth] is separate [from sth else]
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Forming a unit on its own; not connected, shared, or belonging to the same entity.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The students submitted their research in three separate folders.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 学生们将他们的研究报告装在了三个单独的文件夹里。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Of a couple) To stop living together as a couple, often as a prelude to divorce.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They decided to separate last summer after realizing their differences were insurmountable.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在意识到他们之间的分歧无法克服后，他们于去年夏天决定分居。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To distinguish or differentiate between two things, often mentally or theoretically.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It is difficult to separate the genuine concerns of the public from the political rhetoric.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 很难将公众的真正关切与政治言论区分开来。
